item.title: Jan add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Jan add a quote by Ken Robinson
item.description: "Creativity is as important as literacy" -- Ken Robinson

item.title: Jan add a quote by Ken Robinson
item.description: "Human resources are like natural resources; they're often buried deep. You have to go looking for them, they're not just lying around on the surface. You have to create the circumstances where they show themselves." -- Ken Robinson

item.title: Jan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jan add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jan add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "Sir, I shall not defeat you - I shall transcend you." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Jan add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "The secret to success is constancy of purpose." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Jan add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jan add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Just the other day, I was in my neighborhood Starbucks, waiting for the post office to open. I was enjoying a chocolatey cafe mocha when it occurred to me that to drink a mocha is to gulp down the entire history of the New World. From the Spanish exportation of Aztec cacao, and the Dutch invention of the chemical process for making cocoa, on down to the capitalist empire of Hershey, PA, and the lifestyle marketing of Seattle's Starbucks, the modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top." -- Sarah Vowell
